properties.name: Ballycarbery Castle, Ireland
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  A romantically dilapidated castle covered with ivy, in the centre of a cow field. Some of the internal staircases are intact, so you can explore what remains of the rooms, it makes for fantastic photos too.

properties.name: Blarney Castle, Ireland
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  You could kiss the famous Blarney Stone here, if you want to get swine flu.

properties.name: Brisbane, Australia
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah

properties.name: Cork, Ireland
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  Cork is Cork. Blarney Castle nearby is pretty cool. I\'ve stayed at Kinlay House Hostel and Bru Bar and Hostel - I think I prefer Bru.

properties.name: Iceland - Blue Lagoon
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  This iridescent blue lagoon is filled with the hot water from a nearby thermal powerplant, and is a great place to spend the morning/afternoon. The landscape is breathtaking, sitting in milky blue water surrounded by volcanic rocks. I went there in late Feb, and sitting in the lagoon while it was snowing is one of my favourite travel experiences.

properties.name: Iceland - Geysir
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  The original geyser Geysir is here, but is not currently active. There are a few more bubbling and exploding geysers here, They make for great photos, and demonstrate the power that is geothermal energy. This place was part of the Golden Circle tour that I did.

properties.name: Iceland - Gullfoss waterfall
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  I visited this waterfall as part of my Golden Circle daytrip. It had been snowing very heavily that February, so everything was white and very slippery, but impressive.

properties.name: Iceland - Reykjavik
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  An amazing city, very picturesque, but seriously expensive, even after their economy crashed.

properties.name: Iceland - Thingvellir/Þingvellir
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  Thingvellir NP is home to the largest natural lake in Iceland, a rift valley, and was the Iceland seat of parliament from 930 until 1789. The landscape is truly beautiful.

properties.name: Ireland - Ballinskelligs
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah Very small village with a white sand beach, cafe, priory, etc. The cafe has WIFI. There\'s a hostel here owned by the same people who own the hostel in Portmagee.

properties.name: Ireland - Belfast
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  I visited here for a few days in September 2007, and stayed in the Belfast International Youth Hostel.

properties.name: Ireland - Bray
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  Town only 40 minutes by train from central Dublin. There\'s a nice walk up to Bray Head. I visited here many times in winter 2009.

properties.name: Ireland - Caherciveen
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  The closest town to Portmagee, I used EuroSpar and SuperValu for grocery shopping. There was a great French patisserie there called Petit Delice, with delicious chocolate chip brioches, and one of the Chinese restaurants, Chin Fong, was good value (if you got takeaway). This is the hometown of Daniel O\'Connell. There is also a ferry from nearby Reenard Pt to Valentia Island in the summertime.

properties.name: Ireland - Carrick-a-Rede
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  A rope bridge connected the mainland to a rock island. Very picturesque, visited here in September 2007.

properties.name: Ireland - Dun Laoghaire
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  Pronounced Dun Leery, a small town about 20 minutes south of Dublin by train. Some ferries from England arrive here. I cam here a few times in winter, 2009.

properties.name: Ireland - Enniskerry
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  Very cute village less than an hour from Dublin. Fairly wealthy area, so they\'re mainly posh giftstores etc, but there\'s a good antique shop and two nice cafes. It\'s only a short walk/drive to Powerscourt Estate from here. I visited here many times in winter 2009.

properties.name: Ireland - Giant's Causeway
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  Northern Ireland\'s only World Heritage site, make of 40,000 basalt columns, created by a volcanic eruption. I visited here in September 2007.

properties.name: Ireland - Kilkenny
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  Cute little Irish town, I visited here in September 2007.

properties.name: Ireland - Killarney
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  A very picturesque town with a great National Park. Ross Castle, near the lake is so-so, but the lakes themselves are great. Torc Waterfall is also worth a visit, only a 10-15 minute drive from the town centre. I went there a few times in 2009.

properties.name: Ireland - Killorglin
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  Town that hosts the Puck Fair in August. I visited here a few times in 2009

properties.name: Ireland - Killrelig
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  A village abandoned during the great famine, in a breathtaking position on the side of a cliff. The views are spectacular, and local artists use the old houses to do their artwork now.

properties.name: Ireland - Knockree Hill
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  Knockree Youth Hostel, where I worked winter 2009-10. It\'s located close to the Wicklow Way, and is only an hour\'s walk from Ireland\'s tallest waterfall, Powerscourt Waterfall.

properties.name: Ireland - Portmagee
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  I worked at this hostel in 2009. It\'s such a quaint village, and the harbour is a base for boat trips out to the Skellig Islands.

properties.name: Ireland - Torc Waterfall
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  A waterfall at the bottom of Torc Mountain, about 5m/8km from Killarney. There is free parking, a toilet block, and the waterfall is only a 5 minute walk from the carpark. I visited here twice in Autumn 2009.

properties.name: Ireland - Tralee
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  I visited here a few times in 2009, on shopping trips from Portmagee further south.

properties.name: Valentia Island, Ireland
properties.description: Posted by Iamthemessiah  A large island off the coast of County Kerry, that can be reached by ferry from Caherciveen during the summer, or by the bridge near Portmagee all year round. Bray Head, in the far west corner is a gorgeous one hour return walk to Bray Tower. It has magnificent views of the Skellig Islands, and is a good spot for land-based whale watching. There are a few cafes on the island, a candle factory, St Brendan\'s Well, a slate quarry with grotto, an ice creamery (open in summer), prehistoric tetrapod tracks, a lighthouse, and Geokaun Mountain which has superb views of the surrounds.
